CatDescriptText: Mr. Carlo Rossello, construction worker, 73 Muller Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that students are getting adequate vocational counseling in the schools these days? Do you have any suggestions for increasing or improving it?" answer reads: "I don't think so.  I know a lot of kids who are not interested in school, and I think that this is the result of the lack of a good instruction and encouragement from the teachers.  And I know a lot of other kids who love to go to school but the teachers never pay any attention to them, therefore, many of them lose interest."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Carlo Rossello, wearing light colored t-shirt, cap, and eyeglasses, standing with arms crossed in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunders Flowers store
